summaryText: Wow! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful sermon about building our lives on a firm foundation! Isn't it incredible how the world constantly changes, but God's word remains the same? PT walked us through the critical importance of not just hearing God's word, but actually doing it. He powerfully illustrated how our own desires can trap us, and how the enemy sets up subtle traps to lead us away from God's truth. What struck me most was his challenge about being a 'chameleon Christian' - someone who looks like they love Jesus on Sunday but blends into the world's ways during the week. Travis reminded us that we're called to be light in a dark world, not to conform to the world's changing standards. He broke down how our own desires can lead us into sin, using powerful scriptural examples from Daniel and warnings from Paul about the last days. The core message? Build your life on the unchanging truth of God's word, not on the shifting sands of worldly desires. As PT said, there are only two ways: the way of the world or the way of the word!
mainPoints: Build your life on God's unchanging truth
Our own desires can trap and lead us into sin
Refuse to conform to the world's changing standards

versesMentioned.text: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.
All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness, so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.

Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock. But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.
You believe that there is one God. Good! Even the demons believe that—and shudder.

Therefore, get rid of all moral filth and the evil that is so prevalent and humbly accept the word planted in you, which can save you. Do not merely listen to the word, and so deceive yourselves. Do what it says.
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'

But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy, without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good, treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God— having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.

For the time will come when people will not put up with sound doctrine. Instead, to suit their own desires, they will gather around them a great number of teachers to say what their itching ears want to hear. They will turn their ears away from the truth and turn aside to myths.
For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit what is contrary to the flesh. They are in conflict with each other, so that you are not to do whatever you want.
The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
There is a way that appears to be right, but in the end it leads to death.
Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.

You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot. You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.

Monday.scripture: Proverbs 4:23: 'Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.'
Monday.action: Create a list of personal 'traps' that typically lead you away from God. Identify specific situations or temptations that have historically caused you to compromise your faith.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the subtle traps in my life. Give me wisdom to recognize and resist temptations that pull me away from You. Help me build my foundation on Your unchanging truth. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Peter 5:8: 'Be alert and of sober mind. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.'
Tuesday.action: Practice intentional prayer throughout the day. Set three specific times to pause and ask God to protect you from spiritual traps and keep you focused on His truth.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, make me alert and sensitive to Your Spirit. Help me recognize the enemy's schemes and stand firm in Your word. Fill me with discernment and courage. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: James 1:14-15: 'But each person is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desire. Then desire when it has conceived gives birth to sin, and sin when it is fully grown brings forth death.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one area of personal desire that might be leading you away from God's best. Journal about how this desire conflicts with God's word and pray for transformation.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, reveal the hidden desires of my heart. Show me where I'm choosing my will over Yours. Give me the strength to surrender and choose Your path. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Philippians 2:15: 'That you may be blameless and innocent, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and twisted generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world.'
Thursday.action: Intentionally look for opportunities to demonstrate Christ's love in your workplace or community. Do something unexpected that shows God's character.
Thursday.prayer: God, use me as Your light today. Help me stand out not by my own strength, but by Your love working through me. Give me courage to be different. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 6:10-11: 'Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power. Put on the full armor of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes.'
Friday.action: Study and memorize one Scripture that counters a personal area of temptation. Use this verse as a weapon when faced with spiritual challenges.
Friday.prayer: Lord, equip me with Your word. Help me recognize and resist the enemy's tactics. Make me strong in Your power, not my own. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:5: 'Those who live according to the flesh have their minds set on what the flesh desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.'
Saturday.action: Perform a personal 'spiritual audit'. Evaluate how your daily choices align with God's word versus worldly desires. Make a concrete plan for areas needing realignment.
Saturday.prayer: Holy Spirit, transform my mind. Help me desire what You desire. Give me the strength to choose Your way over my own. Renew my heart and mind. Amen.
